content: It seems in lean 3 I can say theorem x is 10 and I get a theorem whose name is "x is 10" with all the spaces. Is this syntax still available in lean4? I can't find the counter part in lean 4 document not can I find a statement that this is deprecated.

Grepping the reference manual for "french" or "French" gives no hit. Grepping for "Â«" gives hits but none seems to be actually documenting the feature. Am I doing it wrong or is this a hole in the manual?

https://lean-lang.org/doc/reference/latest///////////////Source-Files-and-Modules/#--tech-term-guillemets
Seems to be the doc in question
Oh, then I was just doing it wrong! ( yep, I overlooked one of the hit for "Â«")
#general > Lean Reference search bar adding "/" characters to URL @ ðŸ’¬

This feature is the same as it was in Lean 3.

Hsin-Po Wang said:

It seems in lean 3 I can say theorem x is 10

Can you give an example of what you mean here? What's a Lean 3 example that worked and what wasn't working in Lean 4?
